page.title: 13HOUSING IN THE VILLAGES
page.content: AT CHARLTON AND MARGROVE PARK THE TERRACED COTTAGES WHICH WERE ORIGINALLY BUILT FOR MINE WORKERS ARE BRICK BUILT, MANY ARE CEMENT-RENDERED AND COLOURED IN VARIOUS SHADES. DOORS AND WINDOWS HAVE BEEN REPLACED SO THAT EACH HOUSE HAS ITS OWN INDIVIDUALITY AND MOST HAVE BEEN MODERNIZED AND CONTAIN AMENITIES SUCH AS BATHS, INSIDE LAVATORIES AND RUNNING WATER WHICH WOULD NOT HAVE BEEN PROVIDED ORIGINALLY. MOST OF THE HOUSES ARE OWNER OCCUPIED, THOUGH SOME AT MARGROVE PARK STILL BELONG TO A LOCAL LAND OWNER, AND SOME AT CHARLTONS BELONG TO THE COUNCIL. ONLY ONE HOUSE REMAINS AT MARGROVE PARK WITH THE ORIGINAL STYLE OF WINDOWS AND DOOR AND HAS NOT BEEN CEMENT RENDERED. ALTHOUGH QUITE SMALL, MANYUU OF THESE HOUSES HAVE BEEN MODERNIZED TO A HIGH STANDARD.
